content: the second half of your round yarn should be in front of back cable and draped over and behind tips 1 practice practice practice the more you do it the faster it goes and it will soon become second nature 2 after you turn your work make sure the yarn is in front of the back cable and draped over the back if it is behind the cable it will become a yarn-over and there will be a hole in your work 3 be careful not to knit the first stitch on each round too tight remember the back stitches are on a cable and if you pull the yarn on the first stitch too tight when you turn your work it will be hard to move the stitches from the cable to the needle this is particularly important if you are using large needles 4 if you come across a pattern that is written for double pointed needles add markers where the needles would change until you get comfortable with the magic loop 5 if you accidently pull the cable and lose your loop don t panic just find the center and pull the loop out again 6 occasionally when knitting a pattern or knitting 2 stitches together you may have to adjust the number of stitches on your needle when you get to that point straighten the cable so the stitches slip onto the back cable 7 sometimes the cables get twisted and curled up in front of your hands simply roll the needle between your fingers to uncurl the cable 8 remember this is fun and easy and just takes practice like purling did when you were first learning to knit cast on 20 stitches and practice making a tube until you get the feel of it 9 invest in good needles with a flexible cable otherwise you will get very frustrated talk to your local yarn store i don t recommend any of the needles available at michael s and joann fabrics because the cables twist up too much and make it nearly impossible to magic loop 10 take a deep breath smile and have fun 2 magic loop instructions ©2014 donna sires all rights reserved dsires on ravelry
